author: J.D. Salinger
description: A classic novel about the experiences of a teenager named Holden Caulfield in New York City.

author: Harper Lee
description: A powerful story of racial injustice and moral growth in the American South during the 1930s.

author: George Orwell
description: A dystopian novel that explores the consequences of government overreach and surveillance.

author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
description: An exploration of the American Dream and the decadence of the Roaring Twenties.

book: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
author: J.K. Rowling
description: The first book in the popular Harry Potter series, introducing the world of magic and wizardry.

author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: An adventure novel that follows the journey of Bilbo Baggins as he helps a group of dwarves reclaim their homeland.

author: Jane Austen
description: A classic romance novel exploring societal expectations, love, and misunderstandings in 19th-century England.

author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: An epic fantasy trilogy that follows the quest to destroy the One Ring and defeat the Dark Lord Sauron.

author: Suzanne Collins
description: A dystopian novel set in a post-apocalyptic world where teenagers are chosen to participate in a televised fight to the death.

author: Mary Shelley
description: A gothic science fiction novel exploring the consequences of playing god and creating life.
